title: Ben White continues to repay Marcelo Bielsa's faith in Leeds' promotion push
text:
If Leeds United go on to return to the Premier League for the first time since 2004, the influence of defender Ben White is likely to prove pivotal.

Eyebrows were raised when Sweden international Pontus Jansson was shown the door at Elland Road during the summer and sent packing to Brentford.

Into his place came White on a season-long loan from Brighton following previous loan spells at Newport County and Peterborough in the lower reaches of the Football League.

The 22-year-old had never played in the Championship before this season but Leeds head coach Marcelo Bielsa was aware of his potential and the move is proving a shrewd one.

An excellent defender with fine ball-playing skills, White impressed as much as anyone in a goalless draw at a rain-soaked Hillsborough on Saturday and could consider himself unfortunate not to have won his side team a penalty during the first half when Atdhe Nuhiu brought him down.

White said: “He clipped me a couple of times and I wanted to stay up but I couldn't in the end. I didn't get it but we move on and I think it was a fair result.
